issue.title: Switched to CompletionStage

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixes #4691

The general approach:
- Promise now extends `CompletionStage`.  All `CompletionStage` methods that return `CompletionStage` have been overridden to return `Promise`, and `flatMap` and similar methods have been modified to accept a function that is covariant on the returned `CompletionStage`, so functions that return `Promise` can be used as is.  These changes should allow most uses of `Promise` to be source compatible with `CompletionStage`.
- Most Play APIs that accept a `Promise` from the user now accept `CompletionStage`, this should be a source compatible change.
- Most Play APIs that return or pass a `Promise` to the user still return/pass `Promise`, this should allow users to switch to using `CompletionStage` and still use these APIs.
- All `Promise` methods have been deprecated, including `map`, `flatMap`, `recover` etc, pointing users to the new `CompletionStage` equivalents.
- Since `Promise` used `ExecutionContext`, which supports thread local propagation, but `CompletionStage` uses `Executor`, which doesn't support thread local propagation, a new API has been introduced called `HttpExecutionContext`, which allows getting the current `Executor` at the call site of `CompletionStage` operations, to capture the thread local context, and propagate it to the callbacks.
- The documentation has been updated to talk about `CompletionStage` rather than `Promise`.  The general approach in the documentation is to refer to `CompletionStage` as a "promise", since it's much easier to refer to them with a simple name like promise, and also terminology such as map is used, however when referring to the specific types and methods, then `CompletionStage`, `thenApply`, `thenCompose` etc are used.
- The biggest breaking change is in `Action`, which since it uses the decorator pattern, can't be modified in a source compatible way since the invocation of the decorated action will return `CompletionStage` not `Promise` to the user, however if left as is, would prevent the user from returning `CompletionStage` and force them to use the `Promise` API.

body: Is there any workaround for this problem?

issue.title: DL4J UI is normal on Mac OS but can't start on Ubuntu

repository.name: deeplearning4j
repository.description: Suite of tools for deploying and training deep learning models using the JVM. Highlights include model import for keras, tensorflow, and onnx/pytorch, a modular and tiny c++ library for running math code and a java based math library on top of the core c++ library. Also includes samediff: a pytorch/tensorflow like library for running deep learn...

issue.body:
#### Issue Description

Please describe our issue, along with:
 I built my project on Mac OS,  and try to run on Mac, it just run very well. But along with more data, I try to run it in our server, which is Ubuntu 4.8.2. But the UI can't start again. If i remove the UI code, the program run well again.
```
UIServer uiServer = UIServer.getInstance();
StatsStorage statsStorage = new InMemoryStatsStorage(); 
uiServer.attach(statsStorage);
net.setListeners(new StatsListener(statsStorage));
```
And the exception is : 
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Don't know how to bind argument of type class net.jodah.typetools.TypeResolver$Unknown
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.pathBindableFor(RoutingDsl.java:233)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.with(RoutingDsl.java:190)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.access$000(RoutingDsl.java:66)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl$PathPatternMatcher.build(RoutingDsl.java:362)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl$PathPatternMatcher.routeTo(RoutingDsl.java:298)
	at org.deeplearning4j.ui.play.PlayUIServer.runMain(PlayUIServer.java:121)
	at org.deeplearning4j.ui.api.UIServer.getInstance(UIServer.java:27)

#### Version Information

* Deeplearning4j version:0.9.1
* Scala version:2.11
* platform information (OS, etc):Mac OS and Ubuntu 4.8.2

issue.title: UIServer.getInstance() throws IllegalArgumentException under JDK 1.8.0_51+

repository.name: deeplearning4j
repository.description: Suite of tools for deploying and training deep learning models using the JVM. Highlights include model import for keras, tensorflow, and onnx/pytorch, a modular and tiny c++ library for running math code and a java based math library on top of the core c++ library. Also includes samediff: a pytorch/tensorflow like library for running deep learn...

issue.body:
#### Issue Description

`UIServer server = UIServer.getInstance();` throws an exception under 1.8.0_51+ (in my case, I am using JDK 13)

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Don't know how to bind argument of type class net.jodah.typetools.TypeResolver$Unknown
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.pathBindableFor(RoutingDsl.java:233)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.with(RoutingDsl.java:190)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl.access$000(RoutingDsl.java:66)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl$PathPatternMatcher.build(RoutingDsl.java:362)
	at play.routing.RoutingDsl$PathPatternMatcher.routeTo(RoutingDsl.java:298)
	at org.deeplearning4j.ui.play.PlayUIServer.runMain(PlayUIServer.java:179)
```

Per https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/5136 this is a known bug. Upgrading the Play dependency (which is extremely out of date anyway) will fix this problem.

#### Version Information

Please indicate relevant versions, including, if relevant:

* Deeplearning4j version: 1.0.0-beta4
* Platform information (OS, etc): Windows 10.0.18362.295

issue.title: Java Routing DSL does not work with Java 12 onwards

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
This is the same as issue #5136: from Java 9 onward users see this error:
```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Don't know how to bind argument of type class net.jodah.typetools.TypeResolver$Unknown
```

It looks like it is related to https://github.com/jhalterman/typetools/issues/52, but since this issue is inactive since April 2019, maybe it is time to move away from typetools library. Is this library really required?

### Play Version
2.8.1
